data.title: Drew Right Music - Producer, Mixing & Mastering - Los Angeles
data.meta_description: Producer, Mixing & Mastering Drew Right Music - Listen to samples, read reviews, learn more, contact. Read interview with Drew Right Music, see credits and ...
data.text:
Q: Tell us about a project you worked on you are especially proud of and why. What was your role?

A: Next level Film where I'm the Music supervisor and a Slate of Sony Asia films where I'm Composing and film scoring and My Clients who are landing film and in talks with label deal..s

Q: What are you working on at the moment?

A: Lots of Label and tv and film project

Q: Is there anyone on SoundBetter you know and would recommend to your clients?

A: Myself

Q: Analog or digital and why?

A: Both.. It gives you and incredible sound

Q: What's your 'promise' to your clients?

A: I promise them that if they work hard opportunities will come their way

Q: What do you like most about your job?

A: It never gets Dull

Q: What questions do customers most commonly ask you? What's your answer?

A: How do you make it in this business.. Study the greats and learn form their example

Q: What's the biggest misconception about what you do?

A: People don't think of this as a business because i love what i to

Q: What questions do you ask prospective clients?

A: To you have the patience and endurance to make it in this Business

Q: What advice do you have for a customer looking to hire a provider like you?

A: Look for someone who has the experience and is still relevant today

Q: If you were on a desert island and could take just 5 pieces of gear, what would they be?

A: Piano/Guitar/Protools Rig/Keyboards/Bongo's

Q: What was your career path? How long have you been doing this?

A: 33 Years

Q: How would you describe your style?

A: Hit Style its an mixture of all genres

Q: Which artist would you like to work with and why?

A: I love working with all Artist you never know who's going to be the next superstar

Q: Can you share one music production tip?

A: Always keep an open mind to creating and composing music

Q: What type of music do you usually work on?

A: Pop Hip hop R&B reggaeton Sountrack trap Rock Singer Songwriter

Q: What's your strongest skill?

A: Production and Song writing and working with artist

Q: What do you bring to a song?

A: The hit factor and a unique sound for the artist

Q: What's your typical work process?

A: Music Production Song writing and film scoring and creating

Q: Tell us about your studio setup.

A: Full Service studio Manley Mic Manley and Neve Preamps Protools 12 and Abelton 10

Q: What other musicians or music production professionals inspire you?

A: Quincy Jones Mutt Lang George Martin Rick Rueben and Phil Spector

Q: Describe the most common type of work you do for your clients.
